cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 160 mi SE of Nantucket, Massachusetts
cyclone.trajectory: accelerating northeastward, expected to cross Nova Scotia and then Newfoundland before moving into the North Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just south of Halifax, Nova Scotia

weather_observation.watch_coast: None issued for the U.S. Mid-Atlantic; hurricane and tropical-storm watches cover parts of Prince Edward Island and the Magdalen Islands in Atlantic Canada.
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings from Woods Hole MA to Eastport ME; hurricane warnings for eastern Nova Scotia and western Newfoundland.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Strongest impacts confined to southeastern New England coast, Atlantic Canada (Nova Scotia, Newfoundland, Gulf of St. Lawrence). Mid-Atlantic coast (including Maryland) mainly affected by large swells and rip currents.
weather_observation.wind: Gusty northerly breezes possible, but sustained tropical-storm-force winds are unlikely (<2% chance).
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for Chesapeake Bay–Baltimore area.
weather_observation.rainfall: Light rain bands possible, generally under 1 inch.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Hazardous surf and rip currents along the Maryland and Delaware beaches, which may disrupt maritime traffic entering or exiting the Chesapeake Bay channel entrances.
